text: Bottle at Leightons 20K tasting, thanks to the main man himself. It pours clear rich orange - amber with a small white head. The aroma is rich, oily, sweet, pretty juicy, tangy, toasted brown bread, cinammon roll, toffee and cake. The taste is rich, bitter - sweet, warming booze, vanilla, fudge, leather, wood, chewy malt, varnish, peppery spice and some drying bourbon. Finish is leathery and hot. Full body and fine carbonation. A bit harsh and boozy to be honest.
33 cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Une vraie douceur pleine de rondeur sur les fruits mûrs. Top.

Bottle shared at home. Dark deep reddish amber with thin offwhite head. Sweet roasted barley malts, bourbon, vanilla, hazlenut, caramel, chocolate, raisans, malaga, oak, bread, alcohol, bandaids. Big sweet and moderate bitter. Full body, almost no carbonation. Syruppy feel, alcoholic pucker, roasty bittersweet finish. Starts good with some amazing aroma notes, but later on becomes more and more medicinal/alcoholic. The other aromas dont stand up against it. Last sips were bandaid vodka.

Bottle at home. Deep reddish brown with lots of tiny floaters and small beige head. Massive bourbon, red berries, caramel, toffee, lots of dried stone fruits, old wood, maple syrup, cinnamon. Quite sweet but also a decent balancing amount of bitterness and light tart touch. Full bodied with  alcoholic finish. A bit over the top maybe, but very pleasant to sip slowly.

March 1st 2017Leightons 20K at his posh new gaff! Thanks to our host. Light haze on this amber beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is light, dry and has decent fine carbonation. Smooth dry malts, sweetish. A little dry cream. Fair bit of spicy bourbon. Spicy dried fruits. Tangy bitterness. Smooth and warming finish. Shows its abv a bit, good but Top 50?

St Davids Day 2017 - Bottle share at Leightons 20K. Many congrats! As Emelisse White Label Barley Wine (Heaven Hill BA). Thanks Leighton! Brown with a red hue, translucent with a foamy off-white head. Aroma is vanilla and bourbon, vanilla pudding. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is rich vanilla sweetness and then woody and spicy. A very big beer that comes across a touch harsh. (3.5)

33cl bottle shared at Leightons Penthouse for his 20K. Special thanks to Leighton himself for this beer. It pours a clean amber color with a minimal bubbly beige head. Aroma is sweet and slightly boozy with notes of vanilla caramel raisins bourbon. Taste is also rich and sweet with hooted of vanilla caramel and fruit cake. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice one

Bottle shared in London for the 20k. Pours clear caramel-gold with a creamy, white head. The nose has some buttery toffee, orange peel, rich bread, caramel. Medium to big sweet flavour with more creamy toffee, a little boozy boost, dried berries. Medium to full bodied, lightly chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish with more creamy toffee, rich berries, dates. Well, Im a big fan. Great depth. Rich, hearty.

Bottle shared at the Leighton mega 20k tasting. 1/03/2017. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. A orange copper coloured pour with a halo of white head. Aroma is caramel, alcohol, raisin, cakey, hot alcohol, . Flavour is harsh alcohol, caramel, solvent, harsh, raisin. Palate is medium sweet, harsh alcohol, highish carbonation. Too harsh, paint stripper.

Bue à la pression. Couleur ambrée, plutôt trouble, mousse qui sen va fissa fissa. Nez rond sur le pruneau ou un truc dans le genre... Ah, lamande aussi. Carbo importante pour une bière du genre. Alcool assez violent sur les papilles. Très chouette et ça tabasse bien tout ça.

12oz bottle Id been sitting on a while.  Came in through an International Secret Santa, maybe Christmas 2015.  Pours a muddy dark orange with a ring of white head.  Nose is just so so, caramel, booze, mild vanilla, some orange peel, toffee, malt.  Flavor is much better, whiskey, caramel, vanillin, toffee, raisins, orange peel, wood pulp, some marzipan, nougat, bubblegum.  Finishes quite smooth.  Very nicely done.
330ml bottle. Murky amber shade. Loads of brown sugar, red fruits and bourbon. Chewy taste with fruit cake, caramel. Very big and bold but doesnt feel 15%. Really good.
0,33l fles gedeeld met Bryan. Diep amber met een crème kraag. Geur en smaak met caramel en toffee ook een mooi zuurtje als.in appels. Alcohol wel iets teveel aanwezig.
Reddish orange pour. Nose is boozy, orange, nutty, some veggies. Taste is orange up front, then strong whiskey & wood, bitter and woody finish. Mouthfeel is thin, a touch sticky.

From bottle at Camping Ratebeer 15. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is very sweet with raisins, dark fruits and some alcohol. Taste is very sweet, dark fruits, raisins, bit dry. Full body, soft carbo.

Shared bottle at the 7th Sep 2016 Shrewsbury Exchange Gathering. Cheers for this Mat, our nightcap after an interesting session. Dark amber pour, small tanned head. Malty and Bourbon esters in the nose, some mixed fruit also: taste similar and boozy. Vanilla and mild coffee flavours came through late on: really enjoyed this.

Cloudy copper color as I did a poor job of keeping the sediment in the bottle. Thin white head that quickly shrank to a bare wisp. This has a welcoming nose of dried fruit, bourbon soaked wood and sweet toffee. For a 15% ABV, this drinks very smoothly. Rich caramel and toffee sweetness with just tons of buttery bourbon and wet barrel notes. Flavors of dried fruit and cherries that have been soaking in a Manhattan. This is a very nice sipping beer.

330ml bottle @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, Sep 16, courtesy of myself via monstermagnet. Many thanks! Pours dark, tan head. Aroma is cocoa, bourbon. Taste is layered dark malts, cocoa, bourbon.. brilliantly palate-filling and complex with lots of grainy dark cocoa. Alcohol very well-hidden.

Bottle. It pours cloudy amber with a medium off white head. The aroma is lots of dried fruit and toasted malt. Light bourbon notes. Deep intense malty flavor some alcohol notes. Dried fruity notes. Warming alcoholic finish. A bit too boozy. Light woody. Not much bourbon notes besides of the wood and a whiff of vanilla.

Bottle shared with RichTheVillan thanks to jmgreenuk, cheers John. Ruby amber beer with small head. Aroma is sweet molasses, earthy and grape. Taste is sweet caramel, boozy, some spice and malts. A little oily. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Jmgreenuk cheers John; clear dark chestnut brown pour with a thin tan head, aroma has sweet toffee and red fruits, taste has sweet caramel, some red fruits, a hint of vanilla, big ABV, bourbon.

Bottle
Aroma-alcohol, floral, fruits
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Pours clear caramel brown with a minute brown head which immediately recedes. Aroma is caramel, toffee, oak. Taste is caramel sweet, vanilla sweet, bourbon, oak. slightly boozy.

(330ml bottle from saveur-biere.com) Pours deep ruby with a small lasting fine white head and lace, some floaty sediment. Aroma is layers of malt and barrel, with butterscotch fudge, coconut, light vanilla, wood, caramel, dried fruits and even berries, lightly toasted bread and a bit of bourbon itself. Flavour is rather sweet and equally layered, quite fruity with layers of caramel, vanilla, figs, berry preserves, vanilla, bourbon, wood, a bit spicy towards the finish with clear alcoholic warmth. Much bourbon character in the finish and dry aftertaste. Medium full and a bit oily with very low carbonation. For sure this is pretty barrel-dominated, but I felt like the various components were nuanced rather than appearing in a rough punch to the tongue. Accomplished. Slow slow sipper though.

This barley wine is loaded up with barrel favor. Caramel, pepper, bread flavors. Still a lot of alcohol heat.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from ABC Beers. Poured a hazy medium amber with a bubbly broken white head. The aroma is sweet toffee caramel malt. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a big, oily, sugary sweet, alcoholic liqourice palate. Super strong but the alcohol is nicely in the background. Awesome.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 Bottle from the super pricey oak barrel. Pours hazy amber with an off white head. Bourbon nose, with a bit of malt, candy, caramel and vanilla.

Full bodied, rich, palate, slick texture and soft carbonation. Sugar sweet on tasting and on finish which lingers. Hides abv quite well, but extreme sweetness is the lasting impression and it is too much. Could do with a bit more of a bitter balance. Was expecting great things, but its king of mmah... Nah, this excessive sweetness is twisting my melon

Very tasty beer , this time i will only point out the slightly negative side. Being 15% and overly sweet somewhat blocking hte complexity of the flavours that this might have. I would also prefer a bit more acidity that balances that very sweet burnt sugar taste. The bourbon quality is just fine. this reminds me of Backwoods bastard( which is a scotch, with less ABV) and Sucaba, not better than these two, but also not worse.

33 cl bottle. BBE 12/2020.
Pours clear mahogany color with a very small head. Aroma is sweet caramel-syrup-malt-ripe_fruit mesh, some alcohol comes through, no surprise. Flavor is sweet and surprisingly pleasant, ripe fruits, caramel, some toffee too, subtle alcohol dryness and vanilla. Very pleasant and quaffable considering the alcohol content. Excellent.
5325
Bottle 0.33l at Laitis, Helsinki. BBE 12/2016. Colour is clear orange with very small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dry fruits, raisins, bourbon, some alcohol and malts. Warming.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 12/2015
Aroma has alcohol, fruit candy, vanilla and bourbon-like sweetness. Flavour has woody tones, toffee, caramel, alcohol and peat. Alcohol is present but just cuts the sweetness and warms nicely. Drinking a whole bottle would take a two-hour movie; drinkability is not that great and sweetness takes over after a couple of sips.

330ml bottle from Beergium. Pours dark reddish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of warming alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, oak, berries, toffee, pine, resin, and caramely malts. Taste is smooth, malty and caramely with loads of bourbon, vanilla, oak, toffee, pine, resin and hints of syrup. Finish is smooth, caramely malty and oaky with loads of bourbon, vanilla, toffee and hints of warming alcohol. Pretty balanced and tasty bourbony barley wine.

330 ml bottle. Pours an amber colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of toasted malts, syrup and buttery oakiness. Flavour of sweet toasted malts, sticky syrupy notes, some bitterness, butter, oak, bourbon sweetness and grass. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Sticky, sweet and rich. Great.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Emelisse White Label Barley Wine (Heaven Hill BA) ].Clear medium amber color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, bread, caramel, dried fruit - candy, vanilla, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, alcohol, candy, vanilla, buzzy, figs, dried fruit, caramel. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160422]

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a medium clear brown with a small, white head. Aroma has bourbon-vanilla-booze, lots of dark, dried fruits, light buttery toffee/fudge. Taste is sweet, fudgy, light fruity fig-acidity, smooth, buttery, slightly boozy finish. Average carbonation and a sticky body.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours an intriguing amber, chestnut brown colour, cloudy, foamy beige head that leaves a nice lacing. Vanilla, cask, bourbon, caramel malts in the nose. Taste is full bodied, sweet malty, milky coffee, caramel, butterscotch, coconut, velvety vanilla and bourbon tones, beautiful alcoholic warmth in the finish. Exceptional balance, especially considering the high abv. Absent-low carbonation, oily to sticky mouthfeel. Best Dutch brew?

Bottle, 15%. Unclear amber with tiny head. Aroma is malt, dark fruit, caramel, toasted, oak, wood, bourbon and a little vanilla. Flavour is malt, caramel, wood, oak, coconut, bourbon, vanilla, sweet, dark fruit, toasted, hop, warning, notes of alcohol and a little bitter.

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy amber with an offwhite head. Aroma of rich sweet malt, caramel, vanilla, wood, light coconut, sweet dried fruit, light bourbon, some alcohol. Flavor is rather sweet, rich malty, caramel, vanilla, wood, oak, bourbon, light coconut, dried fruit, booze. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with loads of warming alcohol. For a 15% ABV beer this is fairly easy to drink. 230416
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are nice bourbon, fruits, caramel, candy sugar, malt and hops. Sweet fruity finish.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy caramel, dried fruit, wood and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with heavy alcohol. Oily. 220416

Je proeft dat het een goede barley is die als basis dient voor dit bier, maar ik vind hem gewoon veel en veel te alcoholisch. Er zit een duidelijke whiskey smaak aan, daar moet je van houden. Maar ik heb uiteindelijk niet het idee dat ik bier aan het drinken ben.

Bottle, thanks to rekvium. Hazy red amber with a small white head. Classic vinous BA barleywine aroma of malt, caramel, vanilla, and dried fruit. Sweet malty flavour with caramel and vanilla notes, and a faint yeasty touch.

At a tasting, many thanks, almost no head, clear dark red to brown color, aroma of bread , strawberry jam, dried fruits and gentle oxidised notes, flavor of dried fruits, brown bread and wood with a hint of vanila and spicy tinge behind it all, quite sweet but really mellow. Ar really good barley wine.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Vova. Nice clear amber with a beige head. Great aroma of bourbon, vanilla, coconut, malt, caramel, cookies, a bit of fruitiness, and a bit of booziness. Sweet flavor with malt, caramel, vanilla, bourbon, coconut, cookies, and a bit of booziness. Medium-bodied, slightly boozy. Great stuff.

Bottle thanks to Nikos. Pours hazy orange hazel, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is bourbon, caramel, dark sugars, vanilla. Flavor is fully sweet, light bitter, loads of bourbon, caramel, toffee, vanilla, marshmallow. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Decadent.

Late rating, bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister at Vienna tasting. Brown color with small off white head. Big aroma of toffee, caramel, figs, dried fruit and light vanilla. Just a little bit boozy taste with dried fruit, figs, vanilla and toffee. Lightly boozy finish with warming alcohol. Excellent barley wine.

Bottle at home by ShivanDragon, many many thanks for this one, my friend. Pours deep amber color, white head. Aroma of amaretto, chocolate, coconut, vanilla, caramel, nougat, egg liquor. Taste is sweet, lightly bitter, chocolate, amaretto, caramel, coconut, vanilla, nougat, boozy. Really nice, Edwin, thanks.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2017 Pours copper like color, clear, with off-white foamy tiny head. Visually medium carbonation. Aroma: intense malt aroma, with notes of caramel, toffee, honey, molasses, supported with notes of leather, wood, hint of whiskey, fruits like berries, prunes, etc....
Flavor: rich malt flavor, with notes of toffee, molasses, honey, supported with fruity esters of hops, which takes on dark and dried fruits, notes of leather, wood oak, bourbon, vanilla...15%??? Alcohol is pretty well hidden, still gentle noticeable...
Mouthfeel is sweet, malty/fruity, with notes of bourbon, and with sticky dry finish.
Body is full, texture is soft, carbonation is low. In one word: a Masterpiece.

Bottle at the Vienna tasting February 2016. Many thanks! Clear rusty amber colour. Very rich malty aroma and flavour, featuring lots of caramel, dried fruits, also barrel coconut and warm alcoholic notes. Excellent finish of an excellent tasting, thanks to all.

0,33l bottle at Vienna Tasting shared by me. BB 12/2020. dark brown / redish color, small white head. smells of coconut, light vanilla, raisins, dried fruits, nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes rather alcoholic, coconut, spices, marzipan, nuts, light licorice. finishes rather alcoholic with notes of coconut, spices and licorice. good stuff, quite alcoholic though. but good.
Bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister, many thanks. Brown color with small hire head. Aroma of sweet malt, coconut, alcohol. Strong alcoholic taste with whiskey, coconut, toffee, caramel. Tasty.

Bottle thanks to the man Bursprak. Pours dark amber towards brown with an off white head. Aroma has big sweet caramel notes, dark fruits, big barrel notes, vanilla, butter and some weak tannins. The taste has caramel big barrel notes, dark dried fruits, vanilla and some warming alcohol. Hot indeed but also decadent.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare 16(ish). HAzy copper pour with tiny lacings. Tons of brrrbn notes, coconut, vanilla, caramel, biscuits, light syrup and some light booze.

Brown full bodied beer. Sweet dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar, oak, vanilla, bourbon, tawney port, light roasted malts, citrus fruits, it just keeps going on. Amazing complexity, very well balanced. Never too sweet, just enough bitterness. One of the best barleywines I ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle from Firma Bier.
Copper-brown, hazy body, with a tiny, beige head.
Aroma of bourbon, barrel, toffee, dried fruits, dark berries, vanilla, some cocoa, some tobacco.
Taste follows this, with quite a strong booze.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes alcoholic, astringent, medium dry, wooden, with cocoa, bourbon, tobacco, some fruits.

Tasty. Well integrated bourbon, not too dominant, leaving enough room for the broad malt body and sweet fruit notes. Pretty boozy, which was to be expected because of the high ABV, but I prefer it smoother. So overall not among my favourite style examples, while still a really enjoyable sipper.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours clear brown with a thin white head/edges. Aromas of bourbon, sweet malty caramel notes, vanilla, dark fruits, nuts. Taste has a lot of vanilla barrel notes, fudgey, chocolate, malty, dark fruits.

Bottle brough back from a trip to Amsterdam. Pours deep amber wih a lasting cream head. Lovely slightly smokey bourbon arona with marmalade. The taste is sweet and spicy with orange, toffee and warming booze before a lingering smoky bourbon finish. The acohol is a little over evident and whiskey flavour too prominent for my tastes. I prefered the cognac version. That said, this is still a very fine beer.

Bottle from Santa, thanks for the opportunity!
Somewhat murky brown but I think I disturbed the stuff at the bottom. Minimal white head. Sweet caramel and toffee, fruity, light earth, subtle barrel notes of vanilla and wood with some sweet bourbon thrown in. Too easy to drink for 15% abv, thats a damn fine beer.

On tap at Arendsnest. Hazy amber pour with foamy white head. Aroma is really rich, tons of bourbon, vanilla, intense malty fruity notes but very well blended and definitely not as boozy as the abv may suggest. Taste is sweet, liquory, rich caramel, bourbon, vanilla. Palate is full bodied, med carbonation, creamy. Very surprisingly drinkable, very mellow and appetizing aroma gives place to a rich but not cloying flavor. Delicious.

330 ml. bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours a somewhat cloudy reddish brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of bourbon, dark fruit, and caramel. Taste is bourbon, caramel, dark fruit, sweet malt, and vanilla. Usually not a fan of this style, but this is very good.

(Emelisse White Label Barley Wine (Heaven Hill BA)) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 15%
Deep red colour on the body, clear, with a good sized and thick enough off-white head sitting on top. Quite good retention.
Aroma of dark fruits, red fruits, marmalade, whiskey, alcohol, vanilla, malts, caramel, light toffee.
Taste is sweet, with an alcoholic burn up front and a waming feeling at the finish. Caramel, vanilla, whiskey, light dark fruits, orange marmalade, red fruits, figs, dates.
Medium to full body with the carbonation on the right levels.
Amazing brew, what a great sipper.
Proeverij met ShivandragonRoodbruin, helder met kleine gistvlokjes. Kleine bijna witte kraag. GEWELDIGE barley wine :). Caramel, kandij, vanille en bourbon. Zo hoort het.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, best before December 2020. Clear, deep red with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head and lots of yeast in the glass which was swirled up by the carbonation in the bottle. Sweet, malty and slightly fruity aroma of caramel, bourbon, cinnamon, vanilla, raisins and sugar. Intense, very sweet, malty and slightly fruity taste of caramel, bourbon, raisins, sugar, vanilla and cinnamon, followed by a very long, boozy and warming finish with lots of bourbon notes. Full body, oily mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation (in the glass). Rather complex, wonderful palate and satisfying. Very good!

Bottle. Frothy White good mostly deminishing head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Strong Bourbon Vanilla notes. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Too messy to be World class. Too much Bourbon.

330mL from Beer Cartel BB 12/2020 15%
Seriously deep bronze body, holds a small ring of beige head. 3
Aroma is intense - burnt toffee, vanilla & toasty oak, Bourbon undertones, nutty roasty notes. 8
Body is rich without being cloying, smoooth, holds its booze very well.4
Surprisingly smooth on the body - roast nuts, good Bourbon & cola, vanilla & biscuit, toasted coconut. Firm bitterness, rather long warming bitterness. 8
Very smooth, very good 4.1

Zavaros, mustos, barna színe van, valamint piszkosfehér habja, továbbá remek illatai, amik egy túlcsordult malátásbödön, datolya, aszalt-cukrozott paradicsom és természetesen tejszínes bourbon hangulatát hordozzák. A végtelen mélységek, mennyei magasságok itala, ha létezik tökéletes karakter, ez közel áll ahhoz, a tejszínesen bársonyos krémesség lepelként takarja be és csendesíti le a kirobbanni készülő ízjegyeket, amellett, hogy az élénkség is a jellemvonásai között tüntethető fel a szerkezetnek. Mézédesen vibráló gabonaszirup egy cseppnyi fanyar, élesztős hálóba burkolva, melyhez a komló aromásabb, vadságától megfosztott, érettebb jellegű hangulata is csatlakozik, ezek a jegyek azonban csak tökéletes aláfestésként szolgálnak a whiskey játékához, ami magára von minden figyelmet. Az érlelésnek az a fajta testet öltése ez, amikor a fahordós jegyek nem csak úgy rátelepszenek, semmint inkább beleivódnak az ital lényébe, lelket adnak a karakternek. Ezek alapján azt gondolom szükségtelen túlhangsúlyozni, hogy a műfaj szerelmesei számára kötelező darab.

Bottle thanks to Jeff. Light amber pour with a fleeting white head. Sweet caramel and brown sugar bouquet. Sweet and boozy. Brown sugar, raisins, and caramel malts compete with bourbon oak, and vanilla. Really good mouthfeel. Nice body.

Bottled. Pours amber with an average off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel and bourbon. Sweet flavor that end up dry, with alcohol and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and flat carbonation. An excellent Barley.🌟🌟🌟🌟

330 mL bottle. Hazy amber. Leggy and viscous looking. Smells very boozy. Bourbon. Oak. Caramel malt. Tastes of bourbon, strong oak, and caramel malt. Woody with a little bitterness. Brighter sweetness than I expected. Boozy finish. Heavy. A little sluggish, but very tasty.
Bottle - pours amber color. Thick and syrupy. More is caramel, brown sugar, bourbon and oak. Taste is caramel, slightly sweet, toffee nuts, brown sugar. Very smooth for a 15%.

Bottle 33cl, a clear amber beer with medium head. Nose is on blond caramel, oak and vanilla, plum notes. Aroma is intense on oak, vanilla and blond caramel, very nice barrel and caramel cream notes, alcohol well hidden, light white wine notes, dry grapes, leather, very nice aroma, delightful.

Bottle received in the European swap, thanks to Benzai. Pours hazy reddish brown with a small tan head. Nose has candy, vanilla, coconut, white wood, cotton candy. Flavour is similar; cotton candy, vanilla, coconut, white wood. Pretty sweet, not sticky. Leans towards desert wine with warming alcohol coming in. In some sick way it feels kind of balanced because the alcohol cuts the sweetness, but it is still sweet booze juice.

Bottle. Trade with Rekvium. Cheers Stefan. Pours cloudy ruby amber with a small white head. Fantastic nose of wood, licorice, sweet caramel, bourbon, vanilla and dark overripe fruit. Smooth, soft and vinous with a fine complexity. Lovely sipper and the 15% is nowhere to be found nor felt. World class.

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear dark amber color. Almost no head. Sweet, caramel, raisins, cognac in aroma. Caramel, boozy, sweet, coconut, butter in taste. Crisp mouthfeel. Coconut and toffee in aftertaste. Boozy, but drinkable. Nice sipper after heavy meal.

Misty deep brown pour small head mild carbonation aromas vanilla lovely malt whiskey seems like good barrelling toffee caramel port notes doughy hint dried fruits brown sugar candy the flavours currants sultanas rich sultanas a creamy touch vanilla whiskey malt caramel toffee smooth full tasting brown sugar rich port note doughy touch plums warming touch wonderful barrelling a sippers delight cinnamon some clove pepper candy hop the finish wonderful stuff barrelling is tops rich fruits spice mix yeast alcohol lasting good richness all round a very satisfying Barley Wine of high class

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Soft sweet aroma, touch of coconut, but not sorachi levels. Sweet soft body. Relatively light in the mouth. Beautiful malty and sweet body. Not saying 15% at all, yes its strong, but not boozy. Delicious malty brew.

Bottle. Pours amber without head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, some bourbon, vanilla. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, some bourbon, vanilla, toffee. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew. This is how you do bourbon barrel barley wine.

Orange beer, no head. Nose is heavy on the caramel and toffee, coconut, vanilla. Flavor is malty, caramel, bourbon, vanilla. Finishes with bourbon, vanilla, oak, caramel. Sweet and almost sticky, but still, pretty nice. Hides the substantial alcohol well, surprisingly light on the mouthfeel.
Bottle. Clear amber pour with floaties. Aroma of ripe fruits, malty sugars, vanilla, oak, bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet, fruity, complex, super smooth, great balance. Amazing brew.
From tap @ Uiltjebar, Haarlem. Dark with a offwhite head. Sweet aroma of malts, bourbon, wood, vanilla. Taste is sweet, malts, bourbon, alcohol. Aftertaste of warming alcohol. Nice.

Bottle from het Biermoment, BB Dec 2020, large sample. Almost clear copper color with some tiny debris floating around, short frothy lacing. Aroma of huge cookie and biscuit, vanilla custard, slight grainy, some caramel, bit orange marmalade. Bit sweet in taste, bourbon, cookie, slight booze. Lovely stuff, but heavily overrated.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Magnifique.Au nez, le whisky pète littéralement. Le fond barley wine est loin de passer inaperçu.En bouche, attaque très franche sur un barley wine de grande qualité, grosses notes de vanille/bourbon. Puis monstrueuse longueur whisky.Belle complémentarite, à éviter pour les délicats du barley wine. Belle expérience.
Puissance, caractère, très éthylique.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Couleur ambrée sombre, très légère mousse beige. Nez intense malté cremeux, fut de chene légèrement vanillé. Gout de whisky, bourbon de qualité, bien malté, légèrement caramélisé avec fut de chene, vanille et alcool. Un corps onctueux un peu cremeux, le tout intense, rond en bouche. Fin très longue avec tout ces aromes de bourbon et super alcool réchauffant. Une sacrée degustation, une bombe! Emelisse au sommet.

November 27, 2015. Bottle, shared by linusb, thanks!  Dark amber with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malty, caramel, bourbon, hints of raisins and figs, alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter with a peppery note. Finish is sweet malty and peppery bitter, caramel, dried fruits, bourbon, wood. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, slight oily texture. 
Very good barley wine.

Bottle courtesy of linusb. pours caramel brown with a small beige head that doesnt leave much trace oin the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted coconut, bourbon alcohol and hints of green chilli. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty. mouthfeel is soft, oily, round, boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with caramel, toffee, charred wood, toasted coconut, caramelized almonds, hay, minerals and bourbon alcohol. Really good BA barley wine.

Bottle at Ratebeer Kvillebäcken Winter Gathering, 151127. Clear amber beer with a small head. Malty vinous aroma, caramel, grapes, vanilla, toffee, raisins, some biscuits. Caramel flavor, figs, toffee, caramel, some raisins, banana notes, some warming alcohol. Quite nice.
Kville. Bottle. Pours clear dark amber with a minimal head. Aroma is sweet fruity boozy raisins caramel fruity. Flavor is as aroma bitter astringent dry yet a bit sweet.

From a 330ml bottle on 25/11/2015. Pours a murky dark apricot with no head. The aroma features brown sugar, rye bread, stewed fruit and a good whiff of bourbon. This a is big beer in every sense of the word. Take a sip and you get loads of caramel and toffee, nuts, honey, dates and more brown sugar, followed by a firm, spicy, warming bourbon alcoholic kick. Medium bodied with very mild carbonation. A very pleasant sweet sipper, but Im not convinced its nearly as good as the ratings so far suggest.

Bottle at home, 21st November 15. Netherlands #1 beer and 3rd best rated Barley Wine in the world right now and my #1400 rating. This is good shit. Pours a a dark brown leather colour, slight lacing. Aroma is vanilla, booze heat, caramel, fudge. Taste is vanilla, nuts, bourbon, caramel, booze kick. Very good and gives a nice warm glow / hit

330ml bottle from Firmabier


Dark stuff with a small white head. Strong, smooth and good. Expected still a bit more.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Hazy dark amber color with a fizzy brown head. Aroma has the specific bourbon toffee, coconut and caramel notes. Also has some nuts and raisins and no alcohol burn whatsoever. Taste is sweet with toffee, caramel, raisins and coconut. Gets more bitter and roasty towards the finish and aftertaste. Alcohol is warming but not boozy at all for 15%. Body is quite syrupy with a good amount of carbonation. Really great beer overall, probably the best barrel aged barleywine from Europe.

From bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with a very small white head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, sweet malts, caramel, dried fruits, light wood, not boozy at all. Taste is sweet caramel, vanilla, bourbon, sticky, extreme mouthfeel.
Bottle. Pours amber with a no head. Aroma bourbon, very sweet caramel, vanilla, wood, dried fruit,. Taste is heavy sweet, vanilla, dark fruits, dry wood. Quite complex well hidden abv. Good sipper.
Drank with Bram 11-11 while watching Mr Robot. Awesome beer. Very rich bourbon like taste which is very pleasant. Best barley wine so far for me.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Wow, what a beer! The pour is similar to the base beer, only slightly creamier and with less head. The smell - oh god, the smell. The bourbon mixed with the base beer immediately makes me think of the awesome Firestone Walker barrel-aged beers I have had. Sweet caramel and bourbon, maple syrup and creme brulee just makes my mouth water. The taste is amazing as well, I wish I had more words to describe it - sweet, smooth, caramel flavoured, maple syrup, bourbon etc. Its just the out of place bitterry aftertaste that makes this a less-than-perfect beer, for me. Just try it and find out.

Lexpression du bois du tonneau .. La trace de lalcool initial ...De la vanille, des prunes, du rapadura (du muscavado ? ) ... Plein de trucs symptomatiques des meilleurs Bourbons ... Belle expression qui ma fait passer un moment très agréable.

Fles gekocht bij Vinotake in Waalwijk. Uitgeschonken in De Molen bierglas. Troebel bruin bier met roodachtige gloed, en een kleine lichtbeige kraag.
Fantastisch aroma van; karamel, vanille, rijp donker fruit, bourbon, kokos, honing en eikenhout tonen. Ook het smaakpallet is zeer goed en gebalanceerd, iets plakkerig zoet, en toch met een bittere balans perfect daar doorheen geblend. Onvoorstelbaar lekker deze Barley Wine van Emelisse, haalt met gemak hetzelfde hoge niveau als de beste Barley Wines van De Molen. De Heaven Hill bourbon tonen zijn duidelijk herkenbaar, dit bier lijkt gewoon ook op de Adam from the Wood 1978, van Hair of the Dog waar ik zo enthousiast over was op Borefts 2015. Verder veel karamel, honing, rozijnen, walnoten, kokos, vanille en eikenhout. De afdronk is bitterzoet, met een verwarmende alcohol tinteling van bourbon. Gewoon een geweldige Barley Wine, grote klasse van Emelisse. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Biernavigatie.nl. Amber colour, creamy white foam! Medium carbonation. Sweet nose of caramel, vanilla, malts and bourbon. Thick and full body. Sweet and some fruitiness. Nice.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2016 33cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours dark tan with as garnet glint. Very little carbonation and a fleeting off white head. Aroma is strong vanilla from the bourbon along with the sweet maltiness giving huge toffee, caramel, fruitcake and a chewy mouthfeel. A very good BBA barley wine that holds its own against the big boys in the style. A bargain barley wine which would no doubt be double the price if brewed in the USA,

0.33l bottle. Clear amber body, thin off-white head. Aroma of bread, caramel, yeast, vanilla, dried fruits and booze. Taste of caramel, whiskey, floral hops, dark sugar, vanilla and booze. Thick bodied with a syrupy texture and light carbonation. You can really tell that this one has a huge alcohol content. Good beer, but a bit too much for me both in the sweetness and the booze.

Bottle pour. Caramel brown. Aroma is popping out with the bourbon. Taste is sweet caramel, apple, bourbon, vanilla, yum. Definitely on the sweeter end. Super drinkable. Great barleywine - relies on the barrel a lot but very tasty.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, coconut and alcohol.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque orange/brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet and slightly dry with malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, coconut and alcohol.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. That bourbon it aged on, definitely forms its center flavour. Only some malts, and therefore caramel as well, and alcohol are present besides that barrel. Perfect palate, being thick and amazingly round.

Bottle: Shaker:
Small creamy head. Almost clear amber orange body.
World class aroma! Immense: bread, vanilla, fudge, pastry, pudding, sweet wood, light sherry tint, cream, somewhat sweet, butter and butterscotch... Seriously beautiful aroma! Chapeau chapeau!
Flavour is pudding, bitter, alcohol spice, vanilla, bitter, herbal, hay, sweet wood, butterscotch, some fudge, caramel, malts, etc etc. Very tasty!
Aftertaste is malty, little warming tones, some sweet wood and vanilla and some bitters...
Low carbo, light oily silky mouthfeel, full bodied.
Amazing beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 33cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours ruby with an off-white head, some floaties. Aroma is caramel, lots of honey, vanilla, bourbon, grass, toffee and wood. Flavour is medium sweet and boozy. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is boozy with straight up bourbon, honey and vanilla.

Aroma: vanilla, red fruits, honey, coconut, something strange like baked things.
Appearance: amber color and almost no head.
Taste: malibu, red fruits, vanilla, sweet, honey, barrel, warming alcohol.
Palate: full body and low carbonation, vanilla finish.
Overall: wow, amazing beer, really complex and balanced.

Pours a hazy light colour, sweet aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee. The taste itself is magnificent. There are hints of fragrant cheeses, caramel and the affromentioned chocolate and coffee. And all that with no boozy aftertaste. A true delight and close to perfection!

Clear ruby brown with a small pale head. Aroma is honey, caramel, bourbon, dark fruits. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, sweet on the palate, hides the booze well. Taste is bourbon, brown sugar, dates, raisins, honey. So damn good.

Bottle at home. Aroma of malts, bourbon, plenty of vanilla, oak, caramel toffee, syrup, some dried fruits. Flavour is heavy sweet and a bit boozy. Some bitterness in the aftertaste. Body is full, mouthfeel a bit sticky. Massive and sweet, a beast of a Barley Wine. Just a tad too cloying for me to be a true winner.

Barnás-vöröses zavaros nedű kevéske sárgás habbal a tetején. Illatban és ízben egy whisky-s-fahordós-karamelles, testes árpabor kerül elénk, amiben van valami különös vaniliás-kókuszos vonulat is. Egy csoda!
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Pours in a dark clear ruby color with almost no head. Aroma; barrel age bourbon, wood, caramel and vanilla. Taste; sweet on the lips with bourbon, caramel and vanilla flavour...
A: Dark copper Brown/amber/red. No head. N: Caramel, toffee, bourbon, vanilla T: Taste follows nose very well! A bit boozy at rhe end. O: Small carbo. Very nice and warming. Packed with flavours!
Draft at BX. Opaque dark ruby, only small foam ring remaining. Great aroma and outstanding taste and aftertaste. Very smooth, fruity. Topper of the evening. (Arnhem 201509)
On of the best beers at Gents Bierfestival.Bourbon, vanilla, caramel, sweet but not annoyingly so. Has al the elements a bourbon barley wine should have. Awesome.

hazy brown colour with reddish notes, minimal off-white head; aroma of caramel, intensive coconut, vanilla, whisky and woody notes, as well as some herbs; taste is the very same - very strange with this intensive coconut and vanilla notes, nevertheless really good
Bottle at gent beer festival. Pours deep brown, nose is coconut, toffee, vanilla, malty, taste is similar, dry, boozy.

Sampled @ Gents Bierfestival 2015 Trübes oranges Bier mit einer fingerbreiten weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch ist holzig, Vanille, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack nach viel Toffee, Karamell, leicht holzig, alkoholisch.

22/08/2015  sample (bottle) @ Gents Bierfestival shared with JorisPPattyn, Sebletitje, 77ships & PriorL
Red brown with small tanned head. Nose is lots of bourbon, fruits. Taste is lots of bourbon again, caramel, vanilla, fruits. A bit too much bourbon for me

22/VIII/15 - 33cl bottle @ 6de Gents Bierfestival - BB: XII/2020 (2015-1113) 
Little cloudy dark amber beer, small irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, lots of bourbon, vanilla, sweet, caramel, bit sugary, some alcohol. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of sweet bourbon, caramel, alcohol, bit sugary, more bourbon, not cloying though. Aftertaste: sourish touch, alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, sugary, sweet, caramel, dried fruits. Loved it.

Poured from a bottle courtesy of my Summer Secret Santa. 
Aroma is malty with a nice caramel and toffee character. Some moderate raisin and light cherry and fig notes. Some medium light oak notes with light bourbon notes. Some light alcohol spice. A hint of smoke. 
Pours a hazy, copper color with some burnt amber hues and a medium sized, moderately thick, tan head that recedes steadily to a thin film that lingers. Medium light lacing and moderate length legs. 
Flavor is moderately sweet with some nice caramel notes and lighter toffee. Some burnt sugar and light toasted bread notes. Moderate bitterness with some medium alcohol warmth and medium light bourbon notes. Light oak and vanilla notes. Malt character works really nicely with the barrel and bourbon notes. Some raisin, fig and prune notes as well. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very nice beer. Really nice malt notes that work well with the oak and barrel notes. Nice dry fruit notes. Really well balanced for its high abv.
Fairly flat. Red-brown colour. Strong bourbon aroma. Whiskey taste with vanilla sweetness. Rich, thick and warming.
Poured a medium reddish amber, small off white head. Aroma of sweet berries, coffee, caramel malt. Full body, vanilla smooth, flavour of very nice bourbon, berries, caramel, fudge.
Ziemlich süßer aber noch nicht plörriger Antrunk. Intensiv, leicht alkoholisch, nur kurzzeitig brennend. Honig, Getreide, süffig. Mittellanger, süßlich malziger Nachhall. 10/9/11/12//11

(Thx! for sharing) Sampled 330 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2015. Deep brown amber, uneven tanned head. Nose is light glue, tad warming, big bourbon caramel goop, vanilla & some maple syrup. Taste is a bit raw, maple, light glue & plastic, big bourbon warming, maple, vanilla, more bourbon, cereal & malts, wood, oak, brown sugar, Warming & thick. Tad messy with a touch of odd flavours but very nice all the same still.

Wederom een prachtige Heaven Hill aged bier van Emelisse, deze keer een Barley Wine. Heerlijk smakend bier, zoet, bourbon, vanille, gedroogd fruit, hout. Totaal anders dan de Heaven Hill IRS, maar net zo lekker. Topper!

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: dark clear brown beer with small carbonation and small ivory/white foam. Smell: whiskey barrel aged, sweet, caramel malt. Candy. Very complex nose and rich. Taste: really good body. Sweet and caramel presence, well balance with the whiskey barrel aged. Very easy drinkable for 15ABV. Sweet and alcohol whiskey finish. Aftertaste: really dry sensation finish as alcohol and sweet whiskey. Really amazing beer!
Bottle, pours hazy copper with very thin head. It?s sweet, slick, full bodied, boozy, with dried fruit, vanilla fudge, nuts, sugar, vanilla, wood. Lovely sipper.

Thnx to Marco ! 
Pours dark intense copperbrown, small head fades fast. Smell is intense, thick, rich sweet, bit booze. Taste is thick, rich, walnut ( I get those a lot in these type of beers, not meaning it as an ingredient ) . Bit bitter, some oak, def grainy and sweet. Some booze. Gentle in its whole, thnx to the multiple complex layers. Very nice !

33cl bottle from brewery. Pours a dark, like brown sugar. Nose of candied sugar. Mouth is sweet, intense, not overly alcoholic (for a 15%er) and complex. Tingles. I am not generally a fan of barley wine, but this is good stuff.

Bottle. dark amber color. Heavy malt, vanilla and dominating bourbon in the aroma. Dried fruit. Full bodied. Quite alcoholic. Lots of bourbon, vanilla, hint of sulphur. Dried fruit. Firestones. Interesting. Needs time to mellow down.

Bottle. Red copper color, no head. Aroma of raisin, vanilla and caramel. Taste of rich raisin and barley at first, then comes a nice wave of boozy bourbon vanilla that leads in a long evolving finish. A true hit.
Brown colored beer with a small white head. Taste caramel, cognac, sweet fruit, wood. Oily texture. Sweet cognac afthertaste. Great beer.
Pours coppers with creamy off tan head. Aroma is raisins vanilla malts. Taste is ditto. Extremely well balanced. Slightly boozy, but hey 15, i like that in a beer-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Pours a bright dark copper to orangebrown colour with a small off white to beige head. Aroma is sweet malty, toffee/caramel with a boost of sweet alcohol, oak/vanilla, bourbon, and ripe red and dried fruit. The taste is sweet again with the bourbon all over over, but not annoying. Dark fruits and caramel malts again. Good balance. Body is lacking a bit of age. But still, one of the best Emelisse beers Ive had. Thumbs up!

Bottle @ Camping RateBeers 2015; Nat & Winderig, courtesy of the crew! Pours a clear brown beer with a thick white head on top. Aroma of bourbon, loads and loads of vanilla, wood, caramel malts, liquid epicness. Flavor is very sweet, boozy, strong alchoholic, vanilla and loads of oak. Masterpiece in the making, with age, this beauty will become Victoria Secret model for sure. Damn girl!!

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 @Camping Ratebeer 2015, caramel met witte lichte kraag, aroma komt erg lekker binnen, mais met heerlijke bourbon. Smaken zijn zoetig, graan, veel bourbon, redelijke body, alcoholisch, zoetig. zacht en glad. prima BA bier!
--edit vandaag weer eens geproefd maar wel verdomd lekker dit !
--en maar weer eens, des te ouder des te beter de smaken !  Amazing !!

At Camping Ratebeers. Clear amber colour, thin white head. Aroma of sweet and light-spicy bourbon, vanilla, whisky liqueur, honey. Flavour is sweet, malty, light spicy, bourbon, vanilla, honey, light leafy, some alcohol but less than expected, bittersweet finish. Full bodied. Good stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2015 Sampled from bottle @ Camping Ratebeers 2015. Clear dark reddish to amber color, average sized off-white head. Aroma is superb: malts, bourbon, wood. Taste malts, sweetish, bourbon, a hint of overripe fruits, softly bitter and some alcohol. Medium body and carbonation. Very well balanced, very nice.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 Mooie caramelkkeur met een goede kraag. Ruikt vanille, crème, zacht, alcoholisch. Smaakt vol, vanille, crème, alcohol. Volle afdronk.

Clear amber colour, white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, bourbon, wood. Malty sweet flavour, caramel, bourbon, raisins, wood, vanilla. Finish warming bourbon, vanilla, caramel, honey, malts. Damn!(from bottle @ Camping Ratebeers 15, Nat en Vochtig)
Bottle @campingratebeer15. Orange/brown color with a small white head. Smells and tastes sweet, fruity, vanilla, bourbon, spicey, barley wine, almond.
Bottle @ camping ratebeer ?15. Clear amber colour with a small white head. Smells sweet barleywine, quite nice. Tastes sweet, barleywine, almond and other nuts, nice. Very full body, soft carbo.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 Donker oranje rood helder bier met een mooie gebroken witte kraag. Ruikt geniaal. Heerlijk vanille, bourbon, overrijp fruit en heel klein beetje alcohol. Smaakt bourbon, alcohol, overrijp fruit en kruidig. Heftig maar geniaal. Nog ietsje te veel carbo maar als je deze langer bewaard wordt het een topper.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2015 Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours very hazy brown with a small off white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, woody barrel notes, sweet dark fruits and molasses. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Sticky sweet lightly thick mouthfeel with a light alcohol burn in the finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers shared with Kermis Scotty001.
Thin creamy off white head. Lovely aroma. Very hazy amber pour. Doesnt taste likes its 15%. Nicely done.

33cl bottle at our camp site in France. Hazy dark brown with a small off-white head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Heavy sweetnes with some bitter tones in its finish. Vanilla, oak, whisky, siruppy caramel tones, malts, warming alcohol, ripe fruits and spices. This quite a strong but still very tasty barley wine.

Bottle at home, poured a clear dark red to amber colour with a non lasting off head. Sweet heaven Hill bourbon hits the nose upfront, followed by sweet sticky caramel malts, toffe, vanilla, and maple, sticky butter, and dried apricots, nose of charred oak, sticky bourbon, and some walnuts. Mouthfeel is very full bodied, and sticky butter, lots of sweet bourbon, and a bit of alcohol heat. But Hey, this is still very fresh. Bit this is so good!

Menu mentioned 15% ABV  Small yeallowish head over deep red-brown beer. Bourbon jumping out of the glass upon pouring; vanilla, fresh oak. Sweet-alcoholic, with massive vanilla & oak. Finish has just a touch of bitter vegetables; Very rich body & velvety MF, alcoholwarming. Another hit - ultimate dessert beer.
